Sakka’s names and their meanings [sn11.1: Maghavā - named after his former life as a brahmanical student named Magha
Purindada - named after his former life as a human being who gave gifts in stronghold after stronghold
Sakka - named after his former life as a human being who gave gifts carefully
Vāsava - named after his former life as a human being who gave the gift of a guest house
Sahassakkha - named after his ability to think of a thousand things in a moment
Sujampati - named after his wife, the demon maiden named Sujā
Lord of gods - named after his role as sovereign lord over the gods of the Thirty-Three
The seven vows undertaken by Sakka in hi: Honoring the elders in the family
Living at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share
Being free of anger, or quickly getting rid of it if it arises
The qualities of a good person according: Being committed to getting rid of stinginess
